tweets.text: And so here we go again in the Thistleberry area of #NewcastleunderLyme - same time of day again at a weekend. Windows closed but it's getting in. This needs emergency action @MattHancock @StinkStopthe #stopthestink @ClareDinnisEA - why aren't you acting? It is getting worse here

River levels remain high in #Horwich and a #floodwarning at #BessyBrook is still in place. Our incident response team are monitoring the situation and liaising with emergency services. 

Keep up to date: https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn

tweets.text: Yet again carcinogenic, toxic gases are seeping through my home thanks to a poorly run landfill & the inaction of the @EnvAgency. Why has this not been declared as an emergency @BorisJohnson @MattHancock ? #StopTheStink #EnvironmentalDisaster #HydrogenSulphidePoisoning
@Cap_it_off @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA @ClareDinnisEA @StinkStopthe #stopthestink https://t.co/aXAcb6fJ7y
Our Windrush neighbour the River Coln is dying and the @EnvAgency just lets it happen. Sound familiar? @Feargal_Sharkey @tomheapmedia https://t.co/j5b4e08b6g

Sea walls along the Romney Marsh coast, and other flood defence projects, have helped better protect 50,000 homes in the South East from flooding over the past 6 years, according to @EnvAgency.  

My report will be on @itvmeridian at 6 üì∫ https://t.co/HDkqKZidzR

@eabroken2020 @EnvAgency Well, in Wales it's @NatResWales who have some fab skilled people, who with the right leadership and funding can turn this baby around. That said, if they don't! Accountability rules. Another senior team needs to replace.
@rivercide_live @GeographyUOM Total regulatory failure putting profit before people and planet.

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

tweets.text: @shafm13 @Feargal_Sharkey @WaterUK @DefraGovUK @Ofwat @EnvAgency @NatResWales @fmwales @Amanwy @Eluned_Morgan Simply our rivers are dying. 3 main causes, agricultural pollution, water company sewage pollution and abstraction, yes even in Wales. Our regulatory organisations are not doing their job though completely at sea due to poor regulation from our representatives.

@ken_colwell For me the law is clear. Water companies should not be dumping sewage into our rivers at all "Save for exceptional circumstances".

That 20% reduction mentioned in that article would still mean discharges are illegal. Question is why are @DefraGovUK and @EnvAgency allowing it?

tweets.text: @HugoSAS @Marthakearney @BBCr4today @sascampaigns @amyslack84 @Feargal_Sharkey @Sewagefreeswim @WindrushWasp Hi Hugo. The problem is that we were awarded designation for the stretch that includes the sewage works. EA only testing upstream and including 1/10th of what was awarded. So the data on sas app is only for cso above the testing not the actual stretch we applied for & was awarded

@tayz_BETH @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @MPGeorgeEustice @DefraGovUK @stopthestink It looks more horrific when seen as a map. Their stance of innocence is nothing less than astounding. What does it actually take for the authorities to wake up and see the untold damage this is causing?
@DefraGovUK @MPGeorgeEustice you have to act you are responsible.

@poppers82 @tayz_BETH @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @MPGeorgeEustice @DefraGovUK @stopthestink I've just driven down the D road and it was absolutely vile around the A34 turnoff and then noticeable until Wolstanton . Got to by Garners and it was stomach turning , reported to EA yet again .

@tayz_BETH @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @MPGeorgeEustice @DefraGovUK @stopthestink Starting to happen more often in kidsgrove and talke . The gas radius is spreading and that just CANNOT be normal or ok in any way no matter what they say in their statements. Even 1 mile is too far as far as I‚Äôm concerned

So tonight on his jolly jaunt the smell from #WalleysQuarrey has made it 7 miles to Kidsgrove. If this isnt nuisence level what is @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @MPGeorgeEustice @DefraGovUK @stopthestink #stopthestink https://t.co/ranvpF81Jx

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

tweets.text: @joe_crowley @BBCCountryfile Good work & keep the pressure up as sadly our rivers aren‚Äôt getting the protection they deserve @EnvAgency any comment ?

The polluted River Wye highlights the problem at large in England's waterways: agriculture and the water industries are following a regulatory framework that is fragmented. And the regulators just don't have the data to assess the true extent of the problem.

tweets.text: @PaulTubb1 @EnvAgency @Feargal_Sharkey @tomheapmedia Bibury

@suesustainable @Jamesxparsons @NaturalEngland @EnvAgencySW @forfrome @WestcountryRT NFU rep for River Axe region told Wye Nutrient Management Board last week that it was 70% agricultural. 
50:50 seems to be a default. The Lugg moratorium was issued on 50:50 but we later found out new homes would be around 0.2%. EA have existing homes at 25% and already reducing.

@Jamesxparsons @NaturalEngland Depends where it is. Somerset River Frome above Frome it is all down to agriculture. And it's poor. And here's a tributary to the Brue a couple of weeks back, full of slurry. Flows to Levels. Reported to @EnvAgencySW , currently under investigation. @forfrome  @WestcountryRT https://t.co/uHqvQSwz3I

@plumeplotter Worryingly every #incinerator on theses plots #exceed their #emmission limits. Why is nothing done it will #kill us all #ClimateEmergency #ClimateCrisis  #co2 @EnvAgency @RossPlayle @RosieP4 @NO_Essex_Burner @UKWIN_Network @TheGreenParty @R4BDg
@Jamesxparsons @EnvAgency @MerryAlbright So how many private septic tanks are still discharging directly into watercourses?

Not only that but the estimated % of pollution source varies across counties e.g. in Somerset it's more of a 50/50 split between diffuse agricultural pollution and wastewater. But has @NaturalEngland fingered the wrong perp at large?

tweets.text: @joe_crowley @RosieP4 @BBCCountryfile @EnvAgency It's not just human excrement, condoms and wipes, by the way. It's farm runoffs that include pesticides, nitrogen fertilisers. Stuff that's difficult to trace back to source. Rivers are something we should proudly protect, but we're descending into making them sewers instead.

tweets.text: An assessment by @EnvAgency of the Wye, estimates the chief source of pollution (~60%+) is agricultural and waste water from existing homes (~25%). Sustainable house builder @MerryAlbright has estimated new homes on the Wye contribute less than 1% of phosphate loading.

@EnvAgencyMids When will the EA use their powers?  This landfill should not be permitted to take anymore landfill material unless to be used for resolving this stench.... not adding more landfill material to keep this menace emitting odours and polluting our air and atmosphere indefinitely????

Our story focused on the English-Welsh border and the River Wye where @joe_crowley sought answers from farmers, housebuilders, the regulators and ecologists about who's really to blame for the huge swells in phosphate surges along the protected River Wye.

tweets.text: @joe_crowley @RosieP4 @BBCCountryfile Enforcement, enforcement, and enforcement again. We should be asking questions about the @EnvAgency's funding cuts over a number of years and their lack of staff resources. What these companies are doing is often illegal - as a recent BBC documentary found. Shit in rivers... Yuk.
